endorsements.name: Glenn Jacobs
endorsements.role: Knox County Mayor · Former WWE wrestler 'Kane'
endorsements.note: Serving as Blackburn's campaign treasurer. Major signal of East TN establishment support.

endorsements.name: Damon Hininger
endorsements.note: Was rumored as potential candidate himself. Brings private prison industry connections and Nashville business establishment.

endorsements.name: Mark Green
endorsements.note: Rose currently holds Green's former seat. Endorsing Blackburn over his own successor is a notable signal.

endorsements.name: Cameron Sexton
endorsements.note: The most powerful person in the Tennessee General Assembly. Signals strong legislative establishment support.

endorsements.name: Randy McNally
endorsements.note: The state's highest-ranking Republican official after the governor.

endorsements.name: 30+ State Legislators
endorsements.note: Significant block of TN General Assembly members have publicly backed Blackburn.

endorsements.name: Chuck Fleischmann
endorsements.note: The only member of TN's congressional delegation to back Rose over Blackburn.

endorsements.name: 92% Tennessee Donors
endorsements.note: Rose has made his Tennessee donor base a core campaign message, contrasting with Blackburn's 22% in-state rate.

endorsements.name: Tennessee Moms Demand Action
endorsements.note: Green served as statewide election lead for the organization before running.

holdouts.name: Donald Trump
holdouts.note: The biggest endorsement in the race. Has not weighed in on the Republican primary. Blackburn is considered the favorite for his backing given their Senate alliance.

holdouts.name: Bill Hagerty
holdouts.note: Running for Senate re-election. Has not endorsed in the governor's race despite being Tennessee's other Republican senator alongside Blackburn.

holdouts.name: Chuck Fleischmann
holdouts.note: Endorsed Rose — making him the lone congressional delegation holdout from Blackburn.

holdouts.name: Bill Lee
holdouts.note: Term-limited and has not endorsed. His position on vouchers and education could make his endorsement complicated for any candidate.

holdouts.name: Tre Hargett
holdouts.note: Rumored as potential candidate himself. Has not endorsed.

analysis.blackburn: Blackburn's endorsement haul is historically dominant for a Republican primary this early. She has locked up the entire TN congressional delegation (except Rose himself and Fleischmann), both legislative chamber leaders, and 30+ state legislators. This institutional support makes it extremely difficult for Rose or Fritts to build a viable coalition within the party.
analysis.rose: Rose's thin endorsement portfolio is his biggest structural weakness. Despite a $6.46M war chest and early TV ads, his inability to win over party leaders forces him into an outsider-vs-establishment dynamic. His strategy appears to be bypassing the endorsement game entirely and going directly to voters through advertising.
analysis.green: The Democratic endorsement picture is sparse across the board, reflecting the party's diminished statewide infrastructure in Tennessee. Green's Moms Demand Action support is meaningful but narrow. The real question is whether national Democratic organizations or prominent Tennessee Democrats like Jim Cooper or Phil Bredesen weigh in before the primary.
